name: Micro-Mac
text:
Micro-Mac
Micro-Mac was a brand of pocket tape recorder.
History
On February 24, 1989, FBI Special Agent Dale Cooper purchased a Micro-Mac tape recorder for $21.89 at Wally’s Rent-to-Own in Seattle, Washington.
Cooper used the Micro-Mac to record messages for his secretary, Diane Evans, throughout his investigations in Twin Peaks.
The recorder had a voice-activated recording function, which was utilized to record phrases spoken by the myna bird Waldo.
